page.title: 14PLAYING FIELD, CROSS HOUSES
page.content: {In 1982,}off the Cross Houses to Brompton road, a piece of land owned by{The National Trust}was leased to the{Parish Council.}This land had to be drained. Grants were obtained and local people raised further money to pay for the work. At the picnic and games opening by Mr.S.Yates (who farmed the land) in 1984 it was called{"Sidney Yates Play {Field".}Commemorative mugs were presented to all the people who were present. {Money}is still being raised by the 100 Club, fortnightly Bingo and occasional Cheese and Wine Evenings. This is needed to finance the surface of the car park, and the rent and maintenance of the field and for purchase of swings, slides, and a climbing frame.
